import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
# Data to plot
labels = 'White', 'African American', 'Asian', 'Others'
sizes = [77.8, 14.1, 6.6, 1.4]
colors = ['red', 'yellowgreen', 'lightcoral', 'lightskyblue','brown']
explode = (0, 0.1, 0, 0)  # explode 1st slice

# Plot

fig1, ax1 = plt.subplots()
ax1.pie(sizes, explode=explode, labels=labels, autopct='%1.1f%%',
        shadow=True, startangle=140)
ax1.set_title("USA Population % 2018")
ax1.axis('equal')  # Equal aspect ratio ensures that pie is drawn as a circle.

plt.show()

# **What is COVID-19?**

    According to CDC,on February 11, 2020 the World Health Organization announced an official name for the disease that is causing the 2019 novel coronavirus outbreak, first identified in Wuhan China. The new name of this disease is coronavirus disease 2019, abbreviated as COVID-19. In COVID-19, 'CO' stands for 'corona,' 'VI' for 'virus,' and 'D' for disease. Formerly, this disease was referred to as “2019 novel coronavirus” or “2019-nCoV”.
    There are many types of human coronaviruses including some that commonly cause mild upper-respiratory tract illnesses. COVID-19 is a new disease, caused be a novel (or new) coronavirus that has not previously been seen in humans. The name of this disease was selected following the World Health Organization (WHO) best practice external icon for naming of new human infectious diseases.

# **Objective of this Notebook**
  

Before Starting:
This is our first Kaggle notebook being published. If you liked this kernel please don't forget to upvote the project, this will keep me motivated to other kernels in the future. I hope you enjoy our deep exploration into this dataset. Let's begin!

   "Analysis of African American Covid Death Rate" , presents different scenarios(population spread,normal death rate ,covid death rate etc... )   between African americans in comparison with White Americans and other major races in USA.We have tried to show the facts through the available data collected from CDC and respective State data and came up with top 10 states which are highly affected by COVID.We would further like to study and analyse why these states are far more affected than others among the African American communities and also why African Americans have higher incidences.
   
   The novel coronavirus has claimed more than 80,000 American lives through May 11. Data about the race and ethnicity of the deceased is known for about 8 in 10 of these deaths, which we have compiled from Washington D.C. and the 39 states that are releasing these statistics.  The existing data reveals deep inequities by race, most dramatically for Black Americans.
   
   Health Departments all over America are reporting that African Americans have a higher incidence of covid-19 positive cases and deaths .This might be because they are part of front line essential workers,who have to be on job supporting the communities all over USA amid Covid-19 health crisis.
   
   While most of the Americans are ' under stay at home 'order. African American community ,who contribute to 25% of this workforce during crisis  are making sure that we get our food deliveries,grocery deliveries ,they are also working as grocery store employees,as gas station employees,part of postal services ,they are also major part of transportation workers.They are also working in health care and their numbers are in millions ranging from home care nurses to health aids, working in hospitals and pharmacies across America.Does this make them highly vulnerable to Covid-19 ?One can certainly think so and we want to analyse further on this topic.
Your comments and suggestions are welcome.
